title: MySQLBIN()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLBIN()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return a binary representation of 15:
SELECT BIN(15);

Definition and Usage
The BIN() function returns a binary representation of a number, as 
a string value.
Syntax
BIN(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A number
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return a binary representation of 111:
SELECT BIN(111);

Example
Return a binary representation of 8:
SELECT BIN(8);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLBIN()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLBIN()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLBIN()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
